Q_DESC:
Write a program to get the size of a collection. 

Use a collection method to add new data and to get the size of the collection of Collections class. 

If the collection is empty, display a message "Collection is empty"

Hint :
1.Create a HashSet of type String with instance name as "collection"
   HashSet <String>collection = new HashSet <String>();

2. Use BufferedReader Class to get input from the user

3. The Instance for BufferedReader Class is "br"

4. Input "n" number of  String inputs using readline method of BufferReader Class

5. Add the n number of  String inputs to HashSet list using HashSet object "collection".add() method

6. Iterate through while loop using Iterator class hasNext() method and get the elements from the HashSet using next() method of Iterator Class

7. Display the HashSet  list elements using methods (HashSet.size())

8.Check weather the collection is empty using the isEmpty() method of Iterator Class if it is empty then print "Collection is Empty"
TESTCASE_1:
6
